text: Changthang, also known as Byangskat or Upper Ladakhi is a dialect of Ladakhi language spoken by the Changthang people, a subgroup of the Ladakhi people, in Ladakh, Baltistan and Tibet.Carla Faye Radloff (1949-2012) Languages of Northern Pakistan. According to UNESCO, It is an endangered dialect as only 10,000 people speak it. == References == Category:Sino-Tibetan languages Category:Languages of Pakistan Category:Languages of India Category:Languages of China
title: Changthang language
